title: Foot Locker to Buy Two Retailers for $1.1 Billion
sub_head: Sneaker seller to acquire WSS and Atmos as it seeks customers beyond the mall
body:
Foot Locker Inc. is buying two smaller retailers for a total of approximately $1.1 billion in separate cash deals, as the company looks to expand its reach beyond U.S. shopping malls, according to people familiar with the matter.
The New York-based company is expected to announce the acquisitions of athletic retailer WSS for $750 million and Atmos, a Japan-based streetwear and sneaker shop, for $360 million as soon as Monday, they said.
The acquisition of Los Angeles-based WSS, which generated $425 million in revenue in 2020, gives Foot Locker access to a large Latino customer base, an important and fast-growing demographic, one of the people said.
WSS has 93 stores across the West Coast and Southwest U.S., mainly located in working-class, urban neighborhoods instead of the malls where Foot Locker stores are most frequently found.
Foot Locker previously announced plans to move more of its roughly 3,000 stores outside of enclosed malls, a strategy that the coronavirus pandemic had accelerated, Chief Executive Richard Johnson said in an earnings call last year.
